meanings.definition: The quality or state of being straightforward and honest.
meanings.sent1: Her downrightnesses in telling the truth always impressed others.
meanings.sent2: His downrightnesses in dealing with people made him a trustworthy friend.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's downrightnesses on stage had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: The downrightnesses of the old tree's trunk symbolized strength and honesty.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's downrightnesses in grading were appreciated by the students.

meanings.definition: The act of being sincere and direct in one's actions or words.
meanings.sent1: The politician's downrightnesses during the debate won over many voters.
meanings.sent2: I admire her downrightnesses in expressing her feelings without hesitation.
meanings.sent3: The detective's downrightnesses in solving the case surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: His downrightnesses in admitting his mistake showed true character.
meanings.sent5: The downrightnesses of the CEO's speech inspired the employees to work harder.
